alert.note: Alert for Los Angeles County Beaches; Malibu Coast (California) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Beach Hazards Statement issued November 27 at 2:31AM PST until November 27 at 10:00AM PST by NWS Oxnard
info.description: ...BEACH HAZARDS STATEMENT REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 10 AM PST THIS MORNING... * WHAT...Dangerous rip currents and breaking waves due to elevated surf of 3 to 5 feet with local sets to 6 feet. Minor tidal overflow and coastal flooding possible around the time of the morning high tide. * WHERE...Malibu Coast and Los Angeles County Beaches. * WHEN...Until 10 AM PST this morning. * IMPACTS...There is an increased risk of ocean drowning. Rip currents can pull swimmers and surfers out to sea. Waves can wash people off beaches and rocks, and capsize small boats nearshore. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Minor coastal flooding is possible near the time of high tide this morning. The high tide will be at 810 AM PST, with a height between 6.9 and 7.4 feet.
info.instruction: Remain out of the water due to hazardous swimming conditions, or stay near occupied lifeguard towers. Rock jetties can be deadly locations in such conditions, so stay off the rocks.

area.areaDesc: Los Angeles County Beaches; Malibu Coast
